page.name: What Voice Do Learners Hear While Reading?Â
page.content:
Novice readers are often unaware of how self-critical they are. You can help them develop a more positive inner voice by teaching them how to monitor their emotions throughout the reading process. By drawing the learners' attention to how they are speaking to themselves about their own reading process, you can help to remove negative thought patterns.

Over time, this process will help learners remove barriers to understanding information and increase their ability to persist while reading.

While they read, tell learners to ask themselves: 

  • What is the voice in my head saying?
  • Is it a critical voice?
  • Is it a distracting voice?
  • Is it a connecting voice?
  • How can I alter the voice to better support myself in this moment?
